main event: On several nights in October 1966, a witness in Westhampton, Long Island, New York observed various unidentified lights in the sky, including flashing, rotating beacon-like lights and red lights.
interesting points: The objects appeared to be stationary for long periods of at least half an hour before going below the horizon.
On one night, the witness and others saw red lights in the objects.
Similar lights were seen by the witness on an elevation of 20-30 degrees on the night of October 27th at around 11:15 pm.
The descriptions were consistent with Arcturus or an aircraft.
The witness, a retired person, was very reliable and had studied the stars and astronomy for many years as a hobby.
sighted object: Flashing, rotating beacon-like lights and red lights in the sky
